newsitem.title: GERMANY: Karstadt chief may keep post - magazine.
newsitem.headline: Karstadt chief may keep post - magazine.

text.p: The chairman of German retailer Karstadt AG Walter Deuss may be able to retain his post despite challenges from major shareholders, Der Spiegel magazine reported on Saturday.

According to the magazine, employee representatives on the supervisory board have spoken out against his removal, thwarting a plan by supervisory board chairman Guido Sandler to have Duess removed at an extraordinary board meeting.
Sandler represents the interests of the Hertie foundation, which is Karstadt's largest shareholder with a 30 percent stake.

Deuss has come under criticism for failing to turn around the Karstadt group's department store business and shareholders, including Deutsche AG Bank and Commerzbank AG, have pressed for his departure.
